name: JazzyKun
title: UC Berkeley M.E.T. (EECS + Business) | Undergraduate Researcher at FHL VIVE Center for Enhanced Reality
summary:
I am a fourth-year student studying Electrical Engineering and Computer Science + Business at UC Berkeley's Management, Entrepreneurship, and Technology (M.E.T.) Program. Currently, I support ISAACS (Immersive Semi-Autonomous Aerial Command System) as an undergraduate researcher in the Vive Center for Enhanced Reality and Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory. During the semester, I also support the Berkeley Engineering's College Relations Department as a Student Assistant.Feel free to contact me anytime at jasmine.bae@berkeley.edu.I am a fourth-year student studying Electrical Engineering and Computer Science + Business at UC Berkeley's Management, Entrepreneurship, and Technology (M.E.T.) Program. Currently, I support ISAACS (Immersive Semi-Autonomous Aerial Command System) as an undergraduate researcher in the Vive Center for Enhanced Reality and Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory. During the semester, I also support the Berkeley Engineering's College Relations Department as a Student Assistant.

Feel free to contact me anytime at jasmine.bae@berkeley.edu.

name: Gitlet
projects.associated: Associated with University of California, Berkeley
description: * Designed and implemented a version-control system from scratch, leveraging knowledge of Java data structures, object serialization, and file reading/writing* Incorporated features such as saving of file directories, restoring from previous versions, maintaining and merging differing change histories, and collaboration among multiple remote Gitlet repositories* Designed and implemented a version-control system from scratch, leveraging knowledge of Java data structures, object serialization, and file reading/writing

* Incorporated features such as saving of file directories, restoring from previous versions, maintaining and merging differing change histories, and collaboration among multiple remote Gitlet repositories

name: Scheme Programming Language Interpreter
projects.associated: Associated with University of California, Berkeley
description: * Created a fully functional and tail call optimized interpreter for Scheme, a dialect of the function-oriented programming language Lisp, using Python* Implemented large portions of the Read-Eval-Print Loop that parses Scheme expressions into a Python linked list representation, evaluates these expressions, and applies user-defined functions, built-in functions, and special forms. * Created a fully functional and tail call optimized interpreter for Scheme, a dialect of the function-oriented programming language Lisp, using Python

* Implemented large portions of the Read-Eval-Print Loop that parses Scheme expressions into a Python linked list representation, evaluates these expressions, and applies user-defined functions, built-in functions, and special forms.
